trek.name: Lohgad
trek.info: Lohagad (iron fort) is one of the many hill forts of Maharashtra state in India. Situated close to the hill station Lonavala and 52 km (32 mi) northwest of Pune, Lohagad rises to an elevation of 1,033 m (3,389 ft) above sea level.
trek.builtby: Maharaja Suraj Mal, in early 18th century
trek.air: The Pune International Airport is the closest airport and you can easily reach Lohagad by taking the Mumbai-Pune Highway.
trek.rail: The nearest railway station is Malavli.
trek.bus: Lohagad is accessible from Paud via Dudhiware Khind and Kolvan or follow the Mumbai-Pune Highway to reach the place.

trek.name: Sinhgad
trek.info: Sinhagad is a hill fortress located at around 35 km southwest of the city of Pune, India. Some of the information available at this fort suggests that the fort could have been built 2000 years ago. The caves and the carvings in the Kaundinyeshwar temple stand as proofs for the same.
trek.air: Pune is the nearest Airport to Sinhagad. From the airport cabs are available for hire.
trek.rail: Sinhagad can be reached through trains plying till Pune Railway Station.
trek.bus: Hardly an hour journey or two, the road from Pune to Sinhagad is the easiest path taken to reach the fort.

trek.name: Rajmachi
trek.info: Rajmachi Fort is one of the many historical forts in the rugged hills of Sahyadri mountains. It consists of two twin fortresses Shriwardhan Ballekilla and Manaranjan Balekilla, with a wide machi surrounding the two Balekillas.
trek.builtby: Established by the Satavahanas, this citadel was captured in 1657 by Shivaji Maharaj from the ruler of Bijapur.
trek.air: Chhatrapati Shivaji International Aiprort is the nearest airport to reach Rajmachi fort. From the airport many private taxies and cabs are available to reach directly to Rajmachi fort.
trek.rail: Lonavala is nearest railway station to reach Rajmachi fort.
trek.bus: From Pune to Rajmachi fort use Mumbai-Pune Expressway till Lonavala.

trek.name: Torna
trek.info: Torna Fort, also known as Prachandagad, is a large fort located in Pune district, in the Indian state of Maharashtra.The hill has an elevation of 1,403 metres (4,603 ft) above sea level, making it the highest hill-fort in the district.It is historically significant because it was the first fort captured by Chatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in 1646, at the age of 16, forming the nucleus of the Maratha empire.
trek.builtby: This fort is believed to have been constructed by the Shaiva Panth, followers of the Hindu god Shiva, in the 13th century
trek.air: Pune is the nearest airport to reach Torna fort. From pune you can take state transport bus
trek.rail: From Mumbai, one can catch a train to Pune then from swarget you need to take state transport bus to reach Velhe.
trek.bus: From Pune start in the early morning from Swargate bus stand (7:45 am first bus to Velhe reaches around 9:30 am till Velhe the base village). The relevant routes go by via Khed Shivapur, Cheladi/ Nasarapur/ Baneshwar, then Winzar, to the village of Velhe.

trek.name: Visapur
trek.info: Visapur Fort is larger and at a higher elevation than its twin fort- Lohagad.[2] Within the fort are caves, cisterns of water, a decorated arch and old houses.Visapur fort was built much later than Lohagad but the histories of the two forts are closely linked.
trek.builtby: It was built during 1713-1720 CE by Balaji Vishwanath, the first Peshwa of Maratha Empire
trek.air: Pune is the nearest airport to reach Visapur fort. From pune you can take state transport bus
trek.rail: The nearest railhead to Visapur Fort is Malavli station (approx. 5 kms) which is well connected to Mumbai, Lonavala, and Pune via local trains. From Malavli station shared auto/taxi are available for the base village of Visapur Fort
trek.bus: From Pune it is 61km to base village malavli .

trek.name: Korigad
trek.info: Korigad (also called Koraigad, Koarigad or Kumwarigad) is a hill fort located about 20 km (12 mi) south of Lonavla in Pune district, Maharashtra, India. Its date of construction is not known but likely predates 1500. It is about 923 m above sea level.The closest village is Peth Shahpur, about 1 km (0.62 mi) north of the fort.
trek.air: Pune is the nearest airport to reach Korigad fort. From pune you can take state transport bus
trek.rail: The nearest railway station from Korigad Fort is at Lonavala, which is well connected to nearby cities like Mumbai and Pune by rail.
trek.bus: From Pune it is 65km to base village lonavla .
